install.name: JCal pro 2 mini-calendar for Joomsocial
install.author: Anything Digital
install.description: JCal Pro events for Joomsocial displays public and private events to a user in a minicalendar, as part of her user profile.

param.name: coreapp
param.label: Core Application
param.description: Causes this application to not appear in the users applications list but it will allow this application to appear in the user profile automatically if selected.

param.name: cache
param.label: Caching
param.description: Select whether to cache the content of this plugin

param.name: calendars_list
param.label: Calendars to display
param.description: Enter a comma-separated list of calendars numerical id to include in the display. Leave empty to show all calendars.

param.name: categories_list
param.label: Categories
param.description: Ids of JCal Pro categories to show (comma seperated). Leave blank for all.

param.name: private_events_mode
param.label: Show private events?
param.description: Select how to display private events
param.option: Show public and r/o private events (owner still sees private events)
Do not show private events (even if owner)
Show events user owns (even if not private)
Show only private events (if owner is logged in)

param.name: mini_cal_def_picture
param.label: Default Picture Filename
param.description: The filename of the little picture to display. The file you choose MUST be uploaded manually to your server, into the folder components/com_extcalendar/images/minipics. (The default image, \'def_pic.gif\', is already there.) Recommended width of picture is 135 pixels.

param.name: picture
param.label: Picture Display Options
param.description: Type of display for the mini-picture. \'None\' is self-explanatory; \'Random\' chooses random pictures you\'ve uploaded to the \'minipics\' folder; to use the others you MUST upload image files manually to the folder components/com_extcalendar/images/minipics with NUMBERS as the names -- i.e. 1.gif, 2.gif., etc. Daily will use up to 365, a new one every day; Weekly will use up to 7, and so on. Images should be 135 pixels wide to avoid ugliness, but will be resized by the browser if they\'re not.

param.name: navigation_controls
param.label: Show Navigation Arrows
param.description: Yes is recommended. If No, then no arrows will display to move to next/previous month. But a bit of the CSS formatting goes away, too.

param.name: specific_itemid_mini
param.label: Specific Itemid for displaying the module
param.description: Fill this option in case you want minical to open within a specific menu option. Leave blank otherwise .

param.name: show_minical_add_event_button
param.label: Show 'Post New Event' Button
param.description: If \'yes\' then a small button appears below the minicalendar to add a new event.

param.name: target
param.label: Window Target When Clicking a Date
param.description: Leave blank to load in same window (same as \'_self\'). This is recommended. I can\'t think of any reason why you\'d type something here, but I included it it just in case. You can type \'_blank\' to have events open in a new window, which can get ugly, or maybe you have a set up where you need to target a different named frame or something.

param.name: moduleclass_sfx
param.label: Module Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (normally just \'table.moduletable\'), this allows individual module styling
